DOC.brief_title: A Study Evaluate Intravaginal Ejaculation Time Men With Without Premature Ejaculation
DOC.detailed_description: This multinational , multicenter , observational study men without PE . The study consist three visit : one visit screen enrollment , two visit observation 1 2 month ( total duration 8 week ) . No study treatment PE administer patient course study . Patients partner expect attempt sexual intercourse least 2 time week 8-week study period use stopwatch record intravaginal ejaculatory latency time ( IELT ) intercourse . At visit observation period `` patient '' ( and/or partner partner responsible complete questionaires ) also provide patient-reported outcome ( PROs ) answer several questionnaire include topic control ejaculation , satisfaction sexual intercourse , personal distress , interpersonal difficulty , self-esteem . The study estimate distribution average IELT value men PE men without PE .
DOC.criteria: Must stable , monogamous , sexual relationship woman ( 18 year age old ) least 6 month , plan maintain relationship duration study Must good general health Patient partner willing avoid situation activity may effect sexual activity ( eg , refrain preplanned surgery ) Has history drug abuse within past 2 year Has history current major psychiatric disorder mood disorder , anxiety disorder , schizophrenia , psychotic disorder , alcoholism Must erectile dysfunction Patient decrease interest sexual intercourse form sexual dysfunction Patient whose partner decreased interest sexual intercourse , painful intercourse , form female sexual dysfunction Patient whose partner 3 month pregnant
